title: Nethergate Brewery expansion aims for Christmas 2026 opening
description: The Long Melford brewery is given planning permission to expand its site.
content:
A brewery has said it hopes to unveil its expanded and revamped site in time for Christmas 2026. Nethergate Brewery based in Long Melford, near Sudbury in Suffolk, was given planning permission for its project by Babergh District Council earlier this month. It means the brewery will introduce a new taproom, shop, cafe, warehouse, children's playground and more. James Holberry, sales and marketing director, said there would be spades in the ground soon.

"There are a lot of things that might disrupt that, weather being a big one of them, but we're hopeful now that planning has been granted we can get under way," he said. Mr Holberry said the brewery was "bursting at the seams" and ready for the expansion.

The brewery, which also has a taproom in Bury St Edmunds, submitted its plans last year for its expansion. They were given approval on 8 August. Between 15 to 30 part time and full time jobs will be created from the expansion, the brewery says. There will also be new car park with electric vehicle spaces, a new outside seating area, footpaths linking to the nearby country park and some land will be used for growing hops. Managing director Rob Crawford said the development would improve access to the neighbouring country park, making it a "better place to visit with friends and family".
summary: Nethergate Brewery in Long Melford, Suffolk, has been granted planning permission for its expansion, aiming to open its new site in time for Christmas 2026. The expansion will include a new taproom, shop, cafe, warehouse, children's playground and more. The brewery will create between 15 to 30 jobs from the expansion, with the addition to a new car park with electric vehicle spaces, and a new outside seating area. The development will improve access to the neighbouring country park.
shortSummary: Nethergate Brewery aims to expand with a new taproom, shop, cafe, and community hub by Christmas 2026, creating up to 30 jobs.

Take a look at what's in store
Have a visual tour of our proposed development
To visit our full application with Babergh Council, please click the link below.
An Expanded shop & taproom
A welcoming space to enjoy not just our beers and spirits but also a wide range of Suffolk’s beloved food & drink produce. We want this to be a showcase of the best our county and local area has to offer.
Proper parking
Finally, no more squeezing into tight spaces on busy weekends. There’ll be plenty of room for visitors to us and the neighbouring Country Park. Even on bank holiday weekends (hallelujah!)
focused on our environment
We’re a team of local people, and this area means everything to us, so we’re absolutely committed to ensuring that our plans enhance, rather than harm, the environment we’re so fortunate to call home.
That’s why we’re taking significant steps to minimise our impact and embrace initiatives that can make a difference. We’re expanding our solar panel setup to harness more renewable energy and adding more EV chargers for public use. We’re also planning to install a ground source heat pump to efficiently heat and cool our visitor spaces and, on top of that, we’re using some of our space to create a meadow and to plant hops—not just to grow ingredients for our brews but to provide a haven where wildlife can flourish. It’s all part of our commitment to creating a space that works in harmony with our surroundings and supports the local environment we all cherish.
A Destination Worth Visiting
Whether you’re a local popping by for a pint or a tourist exploring Suffolk, we want this place to be the best spot to relax, connect and soak in everything that makes this part of the world special.
We’re incredibly excited about this next chapter and what it could mean for us, the village, and everyone who visits. It’s a big step forward, and we’re committed to creating something that enhances Long Melford, stays true to the character of our beautiful surroundings, and has the local community on board too.
Take a look at the drawings and plans we’ve shared—we’d love your feedback and support as we work towards turning this vision into reality. If you have any questions or thoughts, pop in for a chat with our team or drop us a call on 01787 377087 or email to [email protected]

argos_summary: Nethergate Brewery in Long Melford has received planning permission to expand its site, adding a new taproom, shop, café, warehouse, children’s playground and outdoor seating, with the aim of opening by Christmas 2026. The development will create 15‑30 jobs, introduce a car park with electric‑vehicle spaces, footpaths linking to the nearby country park and a small hop‑growing area. The brewery plans to boost sustainability with expanded solar panels, EV chargers, a ground‑source heat pump and a meadow to support wildlife. Managing director Rob Crawford says the project will improve access to the country park and enhance the village’s appeal for visitors and locals alike.
